description:
You enter a dimly lit room. A mysterious inscription catches your eye.
What has keys, but no locks; space, but no room; and you can enter, but not go in?

A chamber of mirrors reflects your every move, casting shifting shadows.
I am not alive, but I grow; I don't have lungs, but I need air; I don't have a mouth, but water kills me. What am I?

An ancient library with dusty scrolls surrounds you, whispering forgotten tales.
The more you take, the more you leave behind. What am I?

A room filled with water-worn stones and echoing whispers, ancient maps scattered about.
I have cities, but no houses. I have mountains, but no trees. I have water, but no fish. What am I?

A chamber bathed in soft, ethereal light, with delicate objects casting long shadows.
What can travel around the world while staying in a corner?

A room of intricate clockwork and spinning gears, metal glinting in muted light.
I am always hungry; I must always be fed. The finger I touch will soon turn red. What am I?

A room filled with floating, luminescent symbols swirling in ethereal patterns.
I have a head and a tail that will never meet. Having too many of me is always a treat. What am I?

A chamber carved in cold stone, with echoes of hushed whispers and the steady drip of water.
I have a ring, but no finger; I can make you dance when I sing. What am I?

A hallway of mirrored walls stretches infinitely. Reflections fade in and out.
If you drop me, I’ll surely crack; but if you smile, I’ll always smile back. What am I?

You stand beside a babbling fountain in a courtyard overgrown with ivy.
I’m always running, never walking; often murmuring, never talking. What am I?

A hidden alcove filled with dripping candles casting shadows on ancient stone.
I am tall when I’m young and short when I’m old. What am I?

A dim corridor lined with cryptic symbols. A soft breeze stirs dust motes in the air.
Forward I am heavy, backward I am not. What am I?

In a vaulted hall, tapestries depict a strange feast where no one eats.
What has a mouth but never talks, has a bed but never sleeps, and runs but never walks?

A vast, open courtyard under a star-filled sky, silent and still.
I am not a bird, but I can fly through the sky. I cast no shadow, and I make no sound. What am I?

A small, candlelit alcove with secrets whispered in hushed tones.
If you hold me, I will vanish. If you share me, I won't. What am I?

An old gallery filled with dusty portraits and faint echoes of laughter.
I can bring tears to your eyes, resurrect the dead, make you smile, and reverse time. I form in an instant but can last a lifetime. What am I?

A humid chamber with dripping water and a single cloth draped over a chair.
The more I dry, the wetter I get. What am I?

A grand hall with echoing footsteps, distant voices calling your identity.
What belongs to you but is used by everyone else?

A sunlit room where rays stream in through tall windows, illuminating floating dust.
I can fill a room, yet take up no space. What am I?

A quiet courtyard where a single bucket sits by a well.
I weigh nothing, but you can see me. If you place me in a bucket, it becomes lighter. What am I?
